abstract_ssm: Daniel Harris (born Daniel Horwitz), 1903-1987, came to the United States illegally through Cuba after a series of stratagems to escape Russian Lithuania in 1923. He worked as a Communist Party of the United States of America organizer briefly in Harlem while he lived in a Lower East Side rooming house and looked for construction work. This collection contains a clippings notebook of Harris's novella "Going East," typescript copies of two unpublished novellas ("The Blue-Eyed Boy" and "The Comeback"), a full-length unpublished novel, "A Testimony for Sweeney" and a typescript for "Kitty: A Story." The collection also includes an annotated essay guide to the collection written by his daughter Laura Hapke.
corpname_ssm: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
